鉟字的基本解释

鉟
pī
古同“铍”，古兵器，形如刀而两边有刃。
熔化：鉟金。鉟银。
旌旗名。

鉟字的汉语字典释义

[①]［pī］
［《廣韻》敷悲切，平脂，敷。］
［《廣韻》符悲切，平脂，並。］
(1)同“鈹1”。
(2)同“銔”。
(3)熔化。参见“鉟金”、“鉟鋌”。

鉟字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鉟； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1302第03
【廣韻】敷悲切，音丕。【玉篇】刃戈。【韓愈·會李正封聯句】何當鑄鉅鉟。　又與鈹通。詳鈹字註。　又【廣韻】符悲切，音邳。義同。

鉟字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
鉟字的起名意思

古同“铍”，古兵器，形如刀而两边有刃，也是一旌旗名。

Cast iron
Basic explanation of words
Cast iron
pī
The ancient "beryllium" is an ancient weapon, shaped like a knife with blades on both sides.
Melting: cast iron. Iron silver.
Banner name.

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［pī］
["Guangyun" apply sadness, flat fat, apply. ]
["Guangyun" Fu is sad, Pingzhi, and. ]
(1) Same as "Beryllium 1".
(2) Same as "銔".
(3) Melting. See "鉟金", "鉟铤".
Cast iron
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Su Ji 1】【Golden Word Department】　鉟; Kangxi Strokes: 13; Page Number: Page 1302 No. 03
[Guang Yun] Coming sadly, sound pi. [Jade articles] Blade Ge. [Han Yu·Meeting Li Zhengfeng Coupled Sentences] He Dang cast a giant cast iron.　 It communicates with beryllium again. Detailed beryllium word note.　[Guangyun] Fu is sad and cut, with sound. The same meaning.

Taiwan Minutes
Korean Ming Dynasty
Cast iron
Name meaning
In ancient times, "beryllium", an ancient weapon, shaped like a knife with blades on both sides, is also the name of a banner.
pī
1) см. 铍 2) (古兵器，形如刀而两边有刃)
2) плавить
鉟金 плавить золото
3) вм. 銔
